title: For emerging markets, the biggest threat isn’t reduced aid. It’s financial volatility
description: Foreign aid flows from the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) to emerging markets totaled more than forty billion dollars in fiscal year 2023, a sum often portrayed as a lifeline for growth and stability, and one that has drawn intense attention since the agency’s official sh...

title: Angola : GDP growth hits 4.4% in 2024 driven by natural resources
description:
Angola : GDP growth hits 4.4% in 2024 driven by natural resources

Angola’s economy surged by 4.4% in 2024, its highest growth since 2014, driven by oil, diamonds and a rebound in commerce and fishing, according to World Bank Group (WBG) report published on July 25, 2025. Despite this recovery, deep...

title: Empowering consumers: What’s next for Angola
description:
09 July 2025

A new study led by UN Trade and Development helps set the stage for major reforms to strengthen consumer protection in the African nation.

In a key step to strengthening consumer rights, Angola is the first Portuguese-speaking African country to have undergone a voluntary peer review ...
